citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
At time of inspection, a bottle of expired Tramadol was stored in the drug cabinet and records showed that the pot-bellied
pig "Hamton" had been administered this drug as part of a multidrug regimen for pain control for approximately 2 weeks
after its expiration. Use of expired medications in animals is not an appropriate method for treatment and control of health
conditions. Exhibitors must use appropriate methods to prevent, control, and treat diseases and injuries in animals.
Corrected at time of inspection dated 03 July 2023.

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
At time of inspection, the male capuchin monkey "Montel" had near complete hair loss on almost the entire dorsal side of
his tail with dry skin and a moderate amount of white scaling present. First signs of hair loss were noted by caretakers on
24 December 2022 and worsening signs were noted on 4 January 2023. On 6 January 2023, caretakers attempted
treatment by applying coconut oil, but the attending veterinarian was never contacted about Montel's skin condition.
Failure to convey changes in animal health, behavior or well-being to the attending veterinarian in a timely manner can
result in prolonging or worsening of abnormal conditions in the animal. Problems of animal health must be conveyed to
the attending veterinarian in a timely manner.
Correct by communicating Montel's skin condition to the attending veterinarian by 07 July 2023.

In January 2022, the licensee transported a nonhuman primate (Montel the capuchin) from a state authority to their facility
site with the intent of exhibition without a health certificate issued by a licensed veterinarian. Not having required
documentation and assurance for health and fitness of animal to travel may result in their illness or injury. Exhibitors who
transport a nonhuman primate in commerce shall have a health certificate executed and issued by a licensed veterinarian
within 10 days of travel to accompany the animal.
Correct from this date forward of 07 July 2023.

The walls of the primary enclosure for indoor rabbits were constructed of plywood and not substantially impervious to
moisture. Surfaces that retain moisture and cannot be readily sanitized can harbor organisms that may make rabbits ill.
The interior surfaces of indoor housing facilities shall be constructed and maintained so that they are substantially
impervious to moisture and may be readily sanitized.
Correct by 21 July 2023.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
At time of inspection there was no written plan for providing special attention for individually housed nonhuman primates
that cannot see or hear other nonhuman primates of their own or compatible species in the environment enhancement
plan. The cotton top tamarin "Quick" has been individually housed and cannot see or hear other nonhuman primates
since October 2022. Individually housed nonhuman primates that cannot see or hear other nonhuman primates of their
own or compatible species are at risk for poor psychological well-being. Licensees are required to provide special
attention for nonhuman primates in the special consideration group in regard to enhancement of their environment, which
shall be documented in the environment enhancement plan.
Correct by developing and documenting an appropriate plan for special attention for individually housed nonhuman
primates that cannot see or hear other nonhuman primates of their own or compatible species by 21 July 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
At time of inspection, a bottle of expired Tramadol was stored in the drug cabinet and records showed that the pot-bellied 
pig "Hamton" had been administered this drug as part of a multidrug regimen for pain control for approximately 2 weeks 
after its expiration. Use of expired medications in animals is not an appropriate method for treatment and control of health 
conditions. Exhibitors must use appropriate methods to prevent, control, and treat diseases and injuries in animals. 
 
Corrected at time of inspection dated 03 July 2023. 
2.40(b)(3)  Critical
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
At time of inspection, the male capuchin monkey "Montel" had near complete hair loss on almost the entire dorsal side of 
his tail with dry skin and a moderate amount of white scaling present. First signs of hair loss were noted by caretakers on 
24 December 2022 and worsening signs were noted on 4 January 2023. On 6 January 2023, caretakers attempted 
treatment by applying coconut oil, but the attending veterinarian was never contacted about Montel's skin condition. 
Failure to convey changes in animal health, behavior or well-being to the attending veterinarian in a timely manner can 
result in prolonging or worsening of abnormal conditions in the animal. Problems of animal health must be conveyed to 
the attending veterinarian in a timely manner.  
 
Correct by communicating Montel's skin condition to the attending veterinarian by 07 July 2023. 
2.78(a) 
   
Health certification and identification. 
In January 2022, the licensee transported a nonhuman primate (Montel the capuchin) from a state authority to their facility 
site with the intent of exhibition without a health certificate issued by a licensed veterinarian. Not having required 
documentation and assurance for health and fitness of animal to travel may result in their illness or injury. Exhibitors who 
transport a nonhuman primate in commerce shall have a health certificate executed and issued by a licensed veterinarian 
within 10 days of travel to accompany the animal.

Correct from this date forward of 07 July 2023. 
3.51(d) 
   
Facilities, indoor. 
The walls of the primary enclosure for indoor rabbits were constructed of plywood and not substantially impervious to 
moisture. Surfaces that retain moisture and cannot be readily sanitized can harbor organisms that may make rabbits ill. 
The interior surfaces of indoor housing facilities shall be constructed and maintained so that they are substantially 
impervious to moisture and may be readily sanitized. 
 
Correct by 21 July 2023. 
3.81(c)(4) 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
At time of inspection there was no written plan for providing special attention for individually housed nonhuman primates 
that cannot see or hear other nonhuman primates of their own or compatible species in the environment enhancement 
plan. The cotton top tamarin "Quick" has been individually housed and cannot see or hear other nonhuman primates 
since October 2022. Individually housed nonhuman primates that cannot see or hear other nonhuman primates of their 
own or compatible species are at risk for poor psychological well-being. Licensees are required to provide special 
attention for nonhuman primates in the special consideration group in regard to enhancement of their environment, which 
shall be documented in the environment enhancement plan. 
 
Correct by developing and documenting an appropriate plan for special attention for individually housed nonhuman 
primates that cannot see or hear other nonhuman primates of their own or compatible species by 21 July 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
